data.name: Via Ferrata in Zermatt
data.abstract: With its impressive rock formations surrounded by thundering waters, the Gorner canyon between Furri (1865m) and Zermatt (1620m) presents a unique display of the beauty and power of nature.
data.description:
Characteristics: steep, exposed
Route guidance: numerous iron railings, ladders and ropes adapted to the terrain
Suitable for: vertigo-free people of all ages (children from 12 years on).
Highlights: suspension bridges, 3 cable car lifts, pendulum-crossings, 3 abseil spots.
Condition: for all
Ascent / Descent via Zermatt-Furri mountain rail
Length:
approx. 1 kilometer downwards crossing accomplished in 3 to 4 hours.
Rental equipment: /span> equipment included in the arrangement
Departure point: Furri above Zermatt
Via Ferrata in the region: view Saas Fee

data.name: Guided tour of Zermatt and Täsch
data.abstract: The location of Zermatt at the foot of the Matterhorn and in the middle of an enormous hiking and ski region makes it one of the world's most attractive vacation villages.
data.description:
Visitors on a walking tour through the village will discover, for example, why the Valaisian barns are standing on wooden stilts with round stone plates, how villagers earned a living before the tourists came, and how the profession of mountain guides developed. In Täsch, guests can also visit the mill and the bake house. After a stroll through the village, they will see Zermatt and Täsch with different eyes.

Duration: 1h - 1.5h
Number of participants: 1-25
Costs: Zermatt: small fee; Täsch village tour is for free
Languages: German, English, French

data.name: Fly & Dine with Air Zermatt
data.abstract: Climb aboard and reach for the sky – an unforgettable experience awaits amidst the greatest peaks of the Alps.
data.description:
Admire the most beautiful mountains in the world from all sides on this sight-seeing flight from Zermatt. The unforgettable flight is followed by a meal in a special restaurant, serving up a tantalising treat for the taste buds. This gourmet flight combines spectacular mountain scenery with the superb culinary creations of the Valais. Pure enjoyment!

Air Zermatt has been synonymous with reliability and speed for more than 50 years. These red and white starred helicopters and their pilots are world-famous for their expertise, passion and great experience.

data.name: Forest Fun Park in Zermatt
data.description: Zermatt now has a fixed rope park, the Forest Funpark, which features ropeways, rolling ropes and suspension bridges. Anyone taller than 1.40 meters (4.5 feet) can participate. The park has a splendid location at the foot of the impressive Matterhorn. There is also a special trail for kids from 4 to 7 years.

data.name: Your guide to the perfect ski day
data.abstract: Everyone dreams of experiencing the ultimate ski day during their holidays. In reality, achieving this is often not easy – particularly when time is short and there are a huge number of pistes to choose from, as is the case in Zermatt. We’ve put together a step-by-step guide with tips from the locals to guarantee you an unforgettable day on the snow.
data.description:
We’ve all been there: You arrive on holiday in a new ski region and have no idea how to get the best out of your time there. Where is the best place to eat lunch with children, where are the quiet terraces for those looking to soak up a few rays and which après-ski bar is the place to go if you are in the mood for dancing? How can you find out all that the region has to offer? The answer is simple: Zermatt now has a guide to help sporty skiers, families and connoisseurs alike all enjoy the perfect ski day.

More information

image.name: Sportlicher Skifahrer vor dem Matterhorn
image.copyrightHolder: Partner image for editorial and touristic use / Pascal Gertschen

image.name: Familie beim Zustieg zu den Bergbahnen Zermatt
image.copyrightHolder: Partner image for editorial and touristic use

data.name: Matterhorn Ski Paradise
data.abstract: The Matterhorn Ski Paradise offers an apparently endless array of pistes on which skiiers can clock an astronomical number of metres in altitude. Skiers or snowboarders hungry for adventure can even take a diversion to Italy. The Zermatt region is the perfect place to undertake a long-distance ski tour.
data.description:
The plateau above the Theodul Glacier is home to Europe’s highest upper station. From here, it is about 2,000 metres back down to the valley. Thankfully, the route down the mountainside is peppered with restaurants serving delicious food and providing weary guests with a place to rest and recharge their batteries. Skiing, snowboarding and winter hiking are possible throughout the year in Zermatt. In short, this ski region is up there with the best of them and it is worth staying for several days to discover all that it has to offer. We recommend a trip to the Breuil-Cervinia region in the Italian Val D’Aosta. This part of the Matterhorn region boasts 160 kilometres of pistes covering all degrees of difficulty. So if you are in search of a bit of Italianità, look no further than Zermatt.

More information

data.name: Gorner Gorge
data.abstract: The Gorner Gorge is one of the most fascinating scenic attractions in Zermatt. It is an easy 20-minute walk from the south end of the village of Zermatt.
data.description:
Over 130 years ago Zermatt pioneers discovered a particularly lovely natural attraction: the Gorner Gorge. The gorge was formed by the Gornera River over thousands of years and is known for its unique formations and spectacular waterfalls. The green-tinged serpentinite stone is around 220 million years old.

A well-kept path passes through galleries and over wooden walkways. It is an easy 20-minute walk. You can continue on to Blatten or Moos if you would like a longer walk. More adventurous souls can hire a mountain guide to take a three to four-hour tour of the Gorner Gorge.

From the middle of October it's worth visiting the gorge in the afternoon between 3 p.m. and 4 p.m. because the late afternoon sun turns the waters a striking turquoise.

Getting there: Take the train to Zermatt. The entrance to the gorge is a 20-minute walk away.

data.name: Sunnegga - Rothorn
data.abstract: Some people say that the Matterhorn is best viewed from the Rothorn, since it showcases its pyramid shape perfectly. And who are we to argue? The mountains to the east of Zermatt are great viewpoints.
data.description:
The journey into the mountains begins with the underground funicular railway to Sunnegga (2,288 metres above sea level). This was the first funicular in Switzerland to travel entirely inside a tunnel. At Sunnegga you can watch marmots at play, while the nearby Leisee lake is the perfect spot for a swim.

The journey then continues by eight-person gondola to Blauherd (2,571 metres above sea level). From here, the themed Marmot Trail leads back to Sunnegga and the five-lake trail into the valley of the Findel Glacier.

Finally, a big cable car takes visitors to the summit of the Unterrothorn (3,103 metres above sea level). The views of most of the 38 four-thousand-metre peaks around Zermatt are quite simply breathtaking.



Altitude: 3,103 metres
How to get there: Train from Brig/Visp to Zermatt, on foot or by free e-bus (green line) to the valley station Sunnegga-Rothorn: funicular to Sunnegga, gondola to Blauherd, cable car to the Rothorn 
Views: Across Zermatt to the Obergabelhorn, Zinalrothorn and Weisshorn, with the Bernese Alps in the background, over the Findel Glacier to the Rimpfischhorn and Strahlhorn, over the Gornergrat ridge to Monte Rosa and of course the Matterhorn itself
Attractions: Starting point to numerous themed hiking trails (e.g. Five Lakes Walk, Path to Freedom, Flower Trail), Moonlight descent in winter, Sunrise rides, Leisee lake with children’s playground 
Food and drink: Mountain restaurants at all levels, sun terraces with magnificent mountain views, Rothorn cablecar: Sunrise rides including Älpler breakfast every Tuesday during summer
Accommodation: No accommodation at Sunnegga, Blauherd or Rothorn; Fluhalp has single, double, triple, quadruple and group rooms, Mountain Lodge Ze Seewjinu has double, triple, quadruple and group rooms
Groups: Rothorn has two rooms with seating for 76 in each; Blauherd Blue Lounge; Sunegga has rooms with seating for 192, 140 and 100, conferences for up to 200, meeting rooms
Winter: Rothorn Paradise winter sports area, linked to the Gornergrat and Matterhorn Paradise
Special comments: Probably the most photogenic angle for Matterhorn views!

Book your tickets

data.name: 36 kilometres of secured freeride trails
data.abstract: Freerider dreams come true in Zermatt! Carve out tracks in fine powdery snow on 36 kilometres of secured but not prepared pistes. The trails are marked in yellow and can be found on the Rothorn, the Stockhorn and along Lake Schwarzsee.
data.description:
Freeriding in Zermatt is all about gliding down pristine slopes, cutting turns through fine powdery snow and heading off-piste for a few glorious moments away from the hustle and bustle of the resorts. And all this safe in the knowledge that the marked routes are secured. Of course, the usual rules apply: Always ensure you have suitable equipment with you, and ideally enlist the services of an expert guide. Your adventures will be set against the constant backdrop of the Matterhorn, which seems to cast a protective eye over freeriders from afar.

More information

data.name: Matterhorn Glacier Paradise
data.abstract: The Zermatt Bergbahnen AG take visitors right to Europe’s highest mountain station – at amazing 3883 metres.
data.description:
The panoramic view over the largest glaciers of the Alps and over no fewer than 38 breathtaking giants of the Swiss, French and Italian Alps is truly unparalleled. The Mont Blanc, highest mountain of the Alps, appears almost near enough to touch.

Visitors are very close to Italian territory now and look at the “endearing rear” of the famous Matterhorn. Below them at the foot of the mountain, they can see Europe’s largest ski region, open 365 days a year.

Information

Altitude:  3883 m a.s.l.
Arrival: Train from Brig/Visp to Zermatt, on foot or by free e-bus (green line) to the valley station “Matterhorn Glacier Paradise”
Timetable:  Operates year-round
Travel duration to summit:  45 mins
Attractions:  The Crystal Ride cabins: when floating high above the glacier, the glass floor clears up, highest-altitude viewing platform in Europe, Cinema lounge with new thrilling film scenes focusing on Zermatt, available upon request: VIP cableway car with Moët Champagne between Zermatt and Trockener Steg, world’s highest glacier palace with ice sculptures and an ice slide
Food & beverage: Restaurant with local cuisine
Specials:  For adventurers who would like to add a 4000-metre summit to their collection, the Breithorn tour is the very thing, perfect for experienced mountaineers

Book your tickets here.

image.name: Zermatt, Matterhorn glacier ride

data.name: Photo Spot Gornergrat-Matterhorn
data.abstract: Europe's highest open-air cog railway has been transporting visitors from Zermatt to the summit of Gornergrat at 3,089 metres above sea level since 1898. Every second of the 9,339 metre-long, 33-minute journey is an incomparable delight. The Photo-Spot is open all year round and included in the ticket price. It offers one of the best views of the Matterhorn and 28 other peaks over 4,000 metres, including the Monte Rosa massif and the highest mountain in Switzerland, the Dufourspitze which stands at 4,634 metres above sea level.
data.description:
Address:
Gornergrat

Parking:
Täsch has various car parks (parking charges apply).

Access:
From Zermatt with the Gornergrat Railway. The Photo-Spot is located right above Gornergrat station.

data.name: Via ferrata Schweifinen
data.abstract: The Mammoth Fixed Rope Trail Schweifine high above the roofs of Zermatt brings action, views into the depth and a magnificent panoramic vista. Three sections with various degrees of difficulty have been installed. The fixed rope trail can also be hiked with a mountain guide.
data.description:
K5, for the the key overhanging section of route B, which is partly very exposed, K4 for the rest of route B as well as for the long route C, some K2, but mostly K1 for the short, slightly earthy route A. Ladders and/or iron footholds have made the steep sections less difficult.

Location

The fixed rope route is located above the railway station in Zermatt.

Access

From the railway station in Zermatt through Bahnhofstrasse. Shortly after the Alpine Center (Alpin Centrum) the hiker turns right and enters the trail leading to Edelweiss and Trift. Leaving the village, the path leads uphill toward the Trift Gorge. Before the path crosses the bridge over the Triftbach, the path turns right leading to the entrance of the fixed rope trail (approx. 30 minutes).

Fixed Rope Trail

Trail A ascends rocky-earthy terrain, bearing diagonally left. After branching off, the dead-end trail leads to the rappelling point (a mountain guide is mandatory for rapelling) and one hikes a beautiful, exposed section high above the Triftbach stream. Soon one stands in front of a hut called Beresinahütte im Pudel. Here Route B leads downward via a steep section with old stone steps. One can also choose this branch of Route B to reach Route C above the vertical Turuwang. Most of the climbers will descend Route A on a wooded strip, before Route B branches off to the left; the trail to Beresina Hut followed this strip. At the intersection, Route A descends further to the foot of the entire rock wall.
Now up Route B via the smooth, vertical and partially overhanging rock wall, at the top on a metal rope ladder – the key point of the entire tour. Subsequently, one descends in mostly vertical terrain and on a very exposed traverse, even on slightly shaking logs. Finally, the hiker ascends and exits from the Turuwang into the Turu wood, where Route B and C intersect. More beautiful and demanding is the continuation on Route C. Now the tour takes the hiker to a section with a descending traverse and through grooves to a steep ascent, where the arms have to do quite a bit of work. One exits on a shoulder, before traversing up a valley, where at least in early summer the hiking tour passes under a waterfall. Once again the hiker climbs a partially vertical section. A steel rope ladder is a nice diversion. The fixed rope trail ends at about 2,110 meters. Route A can be hiked individually (ideal for families with children above age 10).

Descent

At the exit of Route C one follows the hiking trail to the north, and returns via a loop to Zermatt (4 ½ hours).

Area

Zermatt – Matterhorn Height difference: approx. 650 meters ascent and descent, of which Route A has 320 meters.

Hiking time

4 hours (total), Route A alone is 60 minutes.

More information

Mammut - Via Ferrata

data.name: Wolli Adventure Park Sunnegga
data.abstract: The Wolli Adventure Park Sunnegga above Zermatt is a sunny adventure for the whole family. At the Leisee, the children can expect a mountain playground with a beach, cosy barbecue areas and the legendary panorama.
data.description:
Wolli, the black-nosed sheep and mascot of the destination Zermatt – Matterhorn , loves to climb and enjoy the fresh mountain air. That's why it feels particularly at home in the Wolli Adventure Park near the Leisee ! The adventure park is perfect for children and teenagers up to approx. 12 years old and offers slides, climbing frames and swings as well as water games and wooden ball runs. The idyllic mountain lake invites you to cool off refreshingly, while the adventurous can pull themselves across the water on a wooden raft on a rope. From the shore you also have a fantastic view of the Matterhorn and the surrounding mountains. On the shore, loungers also invite you to relax.
 
The path to the playground is easily accessible and signposted from the Sunnegga mountain station with a stroller. Near the playground there are tables, benches, a toilet, barbecue and picnic areas and a kiosk. Important: Don't forget sunscreen and headgear! A few sun sails provide protection, otherwise no shade clouds the spectacular panorama on the Sunnegga – the name speaks for itself.

data.name: An exclusive sunrise on the pistes
data.abstract: The First Track package in Zermatt is the stuff of dreams for skiers and snowboarders alike. This accompanied downhill run is followed by a hearty breakfast buffet served in the “Matterhorn glacier paradies” restaurant. What better way to start your day?
data.description:
Towering peaks tinged with gold – there are few things in life better than watching a sunrise in the mountains. Except maybe rising with the lark and carving out the first tracks on the freshly prepared pistes. Experience the thrill of making turns against a backdrop of the Valais Alps and the sound of snow crunching under your skis. All early risers are accompanied by an experienced guide. Afterwards, skiers can look forward to a well-deserved breakfast buffet to strengthen them for further skiing in the day ahead.

More information

image.name: Unverspurte Piste frühmorgens in Zermatt
image.copyrightHolder: Partner image for editorial and touristic use / Michael Portmann

data.name: Ski trip around the Matterhorn
data.abstract: The ski safari in Zermatt includes much more than just skiing. Those who take on the challenge cover more than 10,000 metres of altitude in one day. An impressive performance!
data.description: This mountain experience is all about “strengthening those calves!” In just one day, the participants can cover a difference in height of between 10,000 and 12,500 metres. The rules of the top-speed ski safari are simple: never take the same cable car or use the same slope twice on the same day. The challenge starts at the Rothorn at an altitude of over 3,000 metres. The skiers follow a route over the Riffelberg and the Theodul glacier up to Trockener Steg. At that point, the adventurers might start to notice a slight pull in their thighs, but it’s not time to give up yet. Once they reach the glacial paradise of the Matterhorn, the challengers take a short breather and admire the impressive mountain landscape. Then it’s a short detour to Breuil-Cervinia, across the border to Italy. In the evening, the tired heroes once again return to the village of Zermatt via Stafelalp. Exhausted but happy, and with an elevation gain of at least 10,000 metres under their belt.

data.name: Dine on the move
data.abstract: Travelling in style. The trip from Zermatt to St. Moritz/Davos on the Glacier Express is a treat for all the senses as is a gourmet ride on the Golden- Pass Line from the Bernese Oberland to Lucerne. These panoramic routes are among the finest railway experiences to be had anywhere in the world – thanks to the breathtaking views, and to the gastronomic delights served in the dining car. Pure pleasure, in a stunning setting.
data.description:
GoldenPass Classic

The dining car is shaped like a wine barrel. Glass in hand, you’ll glide past the most beautiful parts of Switzerland, from Zweisimmen to Montreux, pampered by the chefs and indulged by the scenery. More Information...

The Salon bleu on wheels

The Belle Époque comes to life in this dining car in the legendary style of the Orient Express. Enjoy anything from a glass of champagne to a multi-course menu. Also available for private events. More Information...

Fondue up on the mountain, or down on the lake

Fondue is always great fun – even more so when the setting is special. You can enjoy one on Mount Rigi, the panoramic mountain high above Lake Lucerne, as you travel on the vintage electric cog wheel railway dating from 1911; or on one of the much-loved fondue cruises on Lake Constance.

A tasty trip through Graubünden

Fresh, seasonal cuisine, great wines and fine brandies are all served in the Gourmino, the nostalgic 1930s dining car that travels the network of the Rhaetian Railways. A year-round calendar offers travellers treats ranging from just-picked asparagus to Buurametzgeta (farmhouse meal featuring a variety of cured meats) and seasonal game dishes. More Information...

Breakfast with Bond – and other peak pleasures

Scaling the mighty peaks of the Alps gives you quite an appetite – even when you make the ascent in a cable car or funicular. Thankfully, when you get to the top, there are special treats in store, like the James Bond Breakfast (daily until 11am) at the Piz Gloria revolving restaurant on the Schilthorn, where “On Her Majesty’s Secret Service” was filmed; or creamy Älplermakkaroni (alpine macaroni and cheese) on the Stanserhorn; or a stylish dinner on the Brienzer Rothorn after a spectacular ride on Switzerland’s oldest steam-powered cog railway.

data.name: Monte Rosa Tour
data.abstract: Monte Rosa is an imposing mountain massif south of Zermatt and comprises 10 summits.
data.description: The Monte Rosa Tour takes you along clearly marked footpaths deep into the mountains and to the top of some of the most beautiful mountains with summits surpassing the 4,000m above sea level mark. The 160 km distance (of which 86 km are on the Valais side and the other 74 km are in the Piemont and Aosta region) is divided into 8 stages and includes 7 mountain passes. Its highest summit, the Dufourspitze (4,634m above sea level), is Switzerland's highest summit and was first climbed in 1855. Europe's highest restaurant is situated on the mountain's 4,554 meter high signalling mound. The Monte Rosa east face is said to be the most imposing rock wall of the Alps. The name originates from an extinct Romance language and means glacier. The Swiss side of the massif can be viewed from the Gornergrat. This walking tour takes 4 days and is suitable for very experienced walkers only.

data.name: Matterhorn Gotthard Bahn – the Alpine adventure railway
data.abstract: The Matterhorn Gotthard Bahn is an Alpine adventure railway par excellence. The line is 144 kilometres long, running from Zermatt to Disentis and from Andermatt to Göschenen, covering a difference in altitude of 3,300 metres, passing through 33 tunnels and galleries, and crossing 126 bridges and viaducts along the way. The lowest point of the journey is Visp, at 625 metres above sea level, and the highest the Oberalppass at 2,033 metres above sea level.
data.description:
The “Matterhorn Gotthard Pass” – pure adventure!
The 2, 3 or 5-day “Matterhorn Gotthard Pass” allows you to free travel on the entire Matterhorn Gotthard Bahn network, on BLS trains between Kandersteg and Domodossola, as well as on the SBB line between Salgesch, Brig and Domodossola and all the PostBus routes in Upper Valais. It also entitles you to a 50% discount on numerous funiculars and cable cars, sports and recreational facilities.
More information

Tickets for the Matterhorn Gotthard Bahn are available on sbb.ch.

image.name: Matterhorn Gotthard Bahn on Viaduct Bugnei

data.name: Ricola Herb Garden
data.abstract: The hiking routes around the resort of Zermatt – site of Switzerland’s most famous mountain, the Matterhorn – offer you breathtaking panoramic vistas, lush flowering meadows and fragrant larch forests.
data.description:
From Zermatt, take the hiking route (half an hour) to the picturesque hamlet of Blatten and stop off at the Ricola Herb Garden situated next to a small chapel and mountain restaurant. Enjoy a fascinating educational tour of the circular herb garden and learn about the 13 herbs contained in every Ricola herb drop.

Information


The Ricola Herb Garden in Zermatt is open from June to September. Admission is free.

Contact and travel information:

data.name: Europe’s highest outdoor pool and spa at 2,222 metres above sea level
data.abstract: Swim against the Matterhorn in Europe’s highest outdoor pool in the Riffelalp resort 2,222 metres above sea level (hotel guests only).
data.description:
Escape the routine of everyday life and treat yourself to a relaxing time in the 2,222m spa while letting your gaze wander over the beauty of the Matterhorn. In the highest spa in Europe you will experience absolute wellness and find yourself in an oasis of profound relaxation. A special highlight is our 35ºC outdoor pool, surrounded by the beautiful panorama of the Valais mountains and with a direct view of Switzerland’s breathtaking landmark, the Matterhorn. The pool measures 8.4 × 4.2m and, with seven massage loungers, six bubble seats and various bubble jets, is an unforgettable bathing experience.

In summer, the Zermatt panorama radiates its full splendour and offers the perfect setting for relaxing on a sun lounger. Basking in the peace and quiet of nature in this idyllic setting.

Getting there: Take the Gornergrat cog railway from Zermatt to Riffelalp.

data.name: Photo Spot Matterhorn
data.abstract: With glorious views of the Matterhorn, a trip to Sunnegga-Rothorn is sure to be an unforgettable experience for young and old alike. It’s part of the Matterhorn ski paradise in winter, turning into a hiking paradise and land of adventure in summer: Whizz down on mountain carts and kick bikes or embark on the five-lake trail and discover the idyllic Lake Stelli, famous for its impressive reflection of the Matterhorn.
data.description:
Adresse:
Zermatt Bergbahnen AG
Postfach 378
3920 Zermatt

Parking:
Täsch has various car parks (subject to charge).

Fussweg:
From Täsch, take the shuttle to Zermatt (around 12 minutes), then walk for around 8 minutes to the valley station of Sunnegga

data.name: Glacier Palace in the Matterhorn Glacier Paradise
data.abstract: High, higher - the Glacier Palace in the Matterhorn Glacier Paradise. Even the mountain train ride tops all records.
data.description:
At 3820 m, you step out into a world of snow, ice and mountain peaks. To the west you see the Matterhorn, the most famous mountain in Switzerland, and in the East is the Breithorn with the majestic Monte Rosa behind it. On the broad glacier between the Klein Matterhorn and the Breithorn is the highest Glacier Palace in the world, offering fantastic views of the fascinating world of snow and ice.

A lift travels 15 m into a glacier where glittering ice crystals and ice sculptures generate a world of their own. They are periodically replaced by new creations from different artists. An ice tunnel continues through the glacier to an ice chute or into a crevasse. Soft and fluffy seats are provided on ice benches to make the icy adventure cosy and comfortable.

Directions:
By car from Sierre via Visp to Täsch, from Täsch by train to Zermatt and by mountain transportation to the Matterhorn glacier paradise, by public transportation from Sierre via Visp to Zermatt, mountain transportation.

image.name: Matterhorn glacier paradise, Gletscher Palast
image.copyrightHolder: Partner image for editorial and touristic use / Michael Portmann

data.name: Climbing route in Gorner Gorge
data.description: The guests climb downhill with a mountain guide and traverse the 1-km long Gorner Gorge. On the dynamic climbing route between the Furi mountain station (1865 m) and Zermatt (1620 m), they rappel three times and conquer the pendulum swing, cable cars and suspension bridges. The tour takes 3 to 4 hours.

data.name: Gifthittli-Furi
data.abstract: The pleasure-packed Gifthittli to Furi piste consists of sun-spoilt carving slopes with fantastic views of the Matterhorn and plenty of mountain restaurants to top it!
data.description:
The high alpine, international ski resort of Zermatt bids beautifully scenic pistes around the Matterhorn. And the pleasure-packed piste from Gifthittli to the Gornergrat region as far as Furi is without doubt one of the best. Broad and sunny carving slopes up to Riffelberg, followed by a section with plenty of bends alongside the Gornergrat railway to the Riffelalp. And last but not least, the home run takes active snow fans past numerous inviting mountain restaurants amidst an enchanting woodland setting as they make their way to Furi.

Information


Starting point: Gifthittli (2935 m a.s.l.)

Accessibility of starting point: chairlift

Destination: Furi (1867 m a.s.l.)

Length: 8.4 km

Altitude difference: 1068 Meter

Gradient: 13% (average), 14% (maximum)

Level of difficulty: intermediate (normal slope)

Food and beverages: on the way, at the finish (Iglu-Dorf, Riffelhaus, Al Bosco (Riffelalp Resort), Alphitta, Chämi Hitta, Ritti, Simi, Furri, Aroleid, Farmerhaus)

data.name: Run with views of the Horu
data.abstract: Get back to childhood ...with shrieks of joy on an exciting ten-minute toboggan run from Rotenboden to Riffelberg in snow-white snow facing the Matterhorn.
data.description:
Youths in Zermatt have a number of names for this exciting run, but summing them all up, talk is of a piste thrilling enough to make sparks fly on an approximately ten-minute ride down from Rotenboden to Riffelberg, to then board Gornergratbahn rail and get back up to do it all over again...which spells fun at any age!
Starting point: Rotenboden (2815 m above sea level)
Accessibility of starting point: Rack railway
Destination: Riffelberg (2582 m above sea level)
Altitude difference: 233 m
Length: 1.6 km
Level of difficulty: easy
Toboggan rental on site: yes
Night floodlighting: no
Refreshments: at the finish

data.name: Dirtscooter and Kickbike
data.abstract: The rapid descents on dirtscooter or kickbike offer the ultimate challenge for all thrill-seekers.
data.description:
Two different stretches offer fun and action in the midst of a breathtaking natural landscape.

Kickbikes on Sunnegga
The rapid descent leads from Sunnegga via Tuftern down to Zermatt. The kickbike scooters can be rented along with a helmet at the valley station of Sunnegga.

Schwarzsee Dirtscooter
One can comfortably reach the mountain station of Schwarzsee by mountain railway. An impressive panorama, as well as a spectacular descent to the valley awaits visitors once they ascend to the top.

Visitors needing a break have the opportunity to stop for a bite to eat at one of the restaurants along the way. The scooter-like vehicles can be returned at the valley station.

data.name: Wolli and the Climate Detective
data.abstract: On the audio-path, at seven audio points adults and children learn in playful manner just what climate change means for the black-nosed sheep Wolli and his friends. And naturally what we can all do to help improve things.
data.description: Who can find the answer why glacial fleas have disappeared? With audio-guide and map, “Wolli and the Climate Detective” wait for you at Zermatt Tourism, where Wolli the black-nosed sheep and his girlfriend - the Alpine Chough, also known as yellow-billed Chough - provide questions and answers. The approximately 1.5 hour hike from Rotenboden to Riffelberg is most entertaining even for kids – and on returning to the village, who knows, one of our young visiting climate detectives may even crack the code to the treasure trove! An informative and entertaining outing for the whole family.

data.name: Climbing the Breithorn
data.description: The guests are tackling a high mountain peak (Breithorn) with a guide from Zermatt. Early in the morning, they take the gondola to the starting point on the Matterhorn Glacier at 3883 m. Three to four hours should be planned to get up and down in ice and snow, depending on the climbers’ fitness.

data.name: Gornergrat
data.abstract: Surrounded by no fewer than 29 peaks above 4,000 meters, such as the majestic Matterhorn and the Dufourspitze as well as the third-longest glacier of the Alps, Gornergrat rewards visitors with unparalleled views.
data.description:
Adventure world
In summer, marvel at the reflection of the Matterhorn on the surface of the Riffelsee and enjoy great hiking trails and cycling routes on this adventure mountain. In winter, the beautiful tobogganing run from Rotenboden to Riffelberg is just one of the experiences on offer, with sunny pistes, a children’s ski park and snowball fights on the winter hiking trail all sure to delight both young and old. 

Information

Altitude: 3,089 m a.s.l.
Arrival: Train from Brig/Visp to Zermatt, from Zermatt by cog railway to the Gornergrat.
Timetable: Operates year-round, during the high season in 24-minute intervals
Travel duration to summit: 33 minutes to the top, 44 minutes back
Attractions: View on 29 peaks above 4,000 m a.s.l., the glaciers of Monte Rosa, reflection of Matterhorn in Lake Riffel (visible in calm weather), journey with the Gornergrat cog railway to 3,089 m a.s.l..
Food & beverage: Restaurant with a view onto Monte Rosa mountain massif, self-service restaurant, gourmet ticket
Specials:

ZOOOM the Matterhorn – a multimedia experience on the Gornergrat.

Reduced rate mountain rail ascent with the Swiss Travel Pass/GA travelcard.

Download comprehensive information, including highlights and an adventure map: PDF Info Guide

Purchase your Gornergrat mountain railway ticket online

data.name: Wolli Park for Beginners at Sunnegga
data.abstract: The Wolli Park for Beginners near the Leisee lake on the Sunnegga provides beginners of all ages with wonderful fun on the snow.
data.description:
One the best places for children and beginners to learn how to ski is at Wolli Park near the Sunnegga station. This beginner’s park is easily accessible to all and is set in a wonderful location – sunny, sheltered and with views of the Matterhorn. The self-use Leisee shuttle runs from Sunnegga directly into Wolliland, where there are four magic carpets (conveyor belts) plus an array of play equipment to provide variety and fun for those involved in snow sports. There are also two chair lifts close by for the more experienced and many excellent restaurants not far away. Visitors to the Park for Beginners can purchase their Wolli ski passes at the points of sale.
Exact location / area: Sunnegga-Leisee, Zermatt (2,288 m.a.s.l.)
Accessibility: Mountain railway
Infrastructure: Magic carpet / conveyor belt, snow carousel, fitness circuit
Children’s ski racing: Yes
Min. age: No min. age
Supervision by children’s ski instructors: Yes (without lunch)
Own use without supervision: Yes, subject to charges
Try-out lessons: Yes
Restaurant with view of the kids’ snow playground: Restaurant Sunnegga
